commentary.line: This is Sidhant Maheshwari, signing off on behalf of Sriram and my co-commentators, Akshay Maanay and Pradeep. Take care folks!
That brings us to the end of our coverage from this game. Both these sides will meet each other for one final time in this series on Sunday. Don't forget to join us then.

Azhar Ali: I think it was a great performance by the team. Obviously, you as a captain want to do well for the team. In both the series, my performances have been good. The seniors have taught me that you can only play your natural game to the best of your ability, that's the only thing you can do, as it is in your hands. The result though is not in your hands. I wanted to mould myself according to how the game has changed. Hopefully, I can continue with this form even longer. The boys did extremely well to contain the opposition to 268. Everyone is working hard and we will keep trying harder. Thanks to the crowd as well.
Azhar Ali spoke in Urdu. We have translated it for you.
Azhar Ali is the Man of the Match for his 104-ball 102

Masakadza: 'The guys really tried hard today. Raza and Chamu (Chibhabha) played really well, but we didn't get enough runs on the board. I thought the wicket was a little drier today, but we were 20-30 runs short. We need to play every game with the same kind of importance. We don't play that many games. The guys need to come out and play well in the final game.'

Earlier, Zimbabwe posted 268/7 in their 50 overs, riding on Raza's century and Chibhabha's 99. Although on a flat batting track, it was never going to be enough and Pakistan comprehensively defeated their opponents.

He was given good support by Asad Shafiq and the duo put on 85 runs for the third wicket. After Shafiq's departure, captain Ali was given good support by Haris Sohail. Ali though departed soon after getting to his second ODI ton. He also became the first Pakistani skipper to score a ton in a successful run-chase. Shoaib Malik walked out and hit some lusty blows towards the end, helping Pakistan chase the total down in the 48th over. Sohail too got to his fifty before the match got over.

With Hafeez injuring his leg while fielding, Sarfraz Ahmed was asked to open the innings with Azhar Ali. Both batsmen started off well, with Pakistan making steady progress in the first few overs before Sarfraz missed out on a sweep and was caught plumb in front. Hafeez then walked out but failed to get going as he fell for a 24-ball 15. Azhar Ali though continued to hold one end and played some superb shots throughout.
The players walk off the field after exchanging handshakes with each other. The Pakistani players and the support staff too walk out to shake hands with their counterparts.

47.2   Panyangara to Sohail, 2 runs, that's it! Pakistan take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series! This was on a good length and outside off, Sohail opens the face of the bat and runs it fine past the keeper, third man runs to his right, slides and stops the ball. The batsmen come back for the second and Pakistan win by 6 wickets

47.1   Panyangara to Sohail, FOUR, Sohail gets to his 7th ODI fifty with this boundary. It was full outside off from Panyangara, Sohail comes down the track and lofts it over extra cover, the ball runs away to the fence
46.6   Vitori to Sohail, 1 run, full and angling in on the pads, Sohail gets an inside edge onto the pad, the ball rolls away down to third man for a single

46.5   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, Malik waits for this full ball to arrive and lofts it over extra cover, there was an easy two available but there was confusion between the two batsmen and they decide against it
46.4   Vitori to Sohail, 1 run, yorker length ball on the stumps, Sohail gets his bat down in time and jams it out to long-on

46.3   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, length ball just outside off, Malik looks to whip it hard, he gets an inside edge onto the pad, the ball rolls away into the off-side and the batsmen take a quick single
46.2   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, FOUR, this time Vitori offers width outside off, Malik slaps it through extra cover, sweeper runs to his right but the ball beats him to the fence
46.1   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, FOUR, Malik is in no mood to hold back today! This was a slower ball pitched up just outside off, Malik was expecting that and lifts it over mid-off with ease
Brian Vitori [7.0-0-40-0] is back into the attack
Pakistan need 19 from 24 balls
45.6   Panyangara to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, yorker length delivery on the stumps, Malik jams out the drive to long-on, he will keep the strike
45.5   Panyangara to Shoaib Malik, no run, nudges this delivery angling in on off and middle towards mid-wicket

45.4   Panyangara to Sohail, 1 run, comes down the track and wanted to play a big shot over the leg-side, his bottom hand comes off the bat as he connects with the ball, he gets a top edge that falls in no man's land in front of the third man region, the batsmen take a single
45.3   Panyangara to Sohail, 2 runs, touch fuller and outside off, Sohail slices the loft over extra cover, sweeper tidies up in the deep and the batsmen take two
45.2   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Sohail defends it towards point
45.1   Panyangara to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, banged in short and at the batsman, Malik helps it down to fine leg and gets to the other end
44.6   Mupariwa to Sohail, 2 runs, slower ball angled across off, Sohail comes down the track and pushes it past backward point, gets back for the second with ease as well
44.5   Mupariwa to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, another slower ball just outside off, Malik comes across and works it past the non-striker, the batsmen take a single as the ball rolls away to long-on

44.4   Mupariwa to Shoaib Malik, SIX, that's hammered! It was the slower ball outside off, Malik reads it quickly, gets forward and lofts it magnificently over extra cover. The ball clears the boundary rope as well and Malik moves into the twenties
44.3   Mupariwa to Sohail, 1 run, nudges this length ball on middle and leg through mid-wicket for a single

44.2   Mupariwa to Sohail, 2 runs, that's delicate from Sohail, this was a good length ball outside off, Sohail waits for it, opens the face of the bat late and runs it down towards third man, who runs to his right and fields, the batsmen take two in the meantime

44.1   Mupariwa to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, just short of a good length and outside off, Malik goes hard at it, the ball rolls away to deep mid-wicket off the inside half of the bat. The batsmen were looking for the second but it's not there
Tawanda Mupariwa [6.0-0-35-1] is back into the attack
Pakistan need 36 from 36 balls
43.6   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, slower ball angling away outside off, Sohail chases it and looks to crack it hard on the off-side, can't lay bat on it though and the keeper collects
43.5   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, just short of a good length and outside off, Sohail hangs back and punches it to cover
43.4   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, Sohail backs away and Panyangara bowls it slightly wide outside off, he leaves it for the keeper in the end
43.3   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, length delivery on off, Sohail turns it to short fine leg, can't get the single away
43.2   Panyangara to Shoaib Malik, leg byes, 1 run, angling in on the pads, Malik fails to get bat on the nudge, the ball rolls away into the on-side off the pad, the batsmen sneak in a quick leg bye

43.1   Panyangara to Shoaib Malik, FOUR, on a good length and just outside off, Malik waits for the ball to arrive, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and gets it fine past the keeper, third man was slightly squarer, he runs to his left, puts in the dive but can only parry the ball over the fence
Tinashe Panyangara [6.0-0-27-0] is back into the attack
Cremer finishes his spell. His figures: 10-0-52-2
42.6   Cremer to Sohail, FOUR, slightly short and turning in on middle, Sohail backs away and cuts it past a diving cover-point, the ball races away to the fence
42.5   Cremer to Sohail, no run, touch quicker and on the stumps, Sohail goes back and nudges it towards mid-wicket, can't beat the fielder there
42.4   Cremer to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, slower through the air and turning away outside off, Malik goes on the back foot and works it through mid-wicket for a single
42.3   Cremer to Sohail, 1 run, comes down the track and eases this fullish delivery down to long-on
42.2   Cremer to Sohail, no run, floated up on off, Sohail plays it with the turn towards square leg
42.1   Cremer to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, short and outside off, Malik cuts it to deep cover, for a single
Graeme Cremer [9.0-0-45-2] is back into the attack

41.6   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, in the air and safe! It was the slower ball well wide outside off, Malik was looking to guide it late towards third man and hits it in the air, but it was to the left of backward point and not in his reach, the batsmen take a single as the ball rolls away to third man
41.5   Vitori to Sohail, 1 run, slightly back of a length just outside off, Sohail punches it down to long-off and gets to the other end

41.4   Vitori to Sohail, no run, slower ball angling in on leg, Sohail fails to nudge it through the on-side and wears it on the pad, there was half an appeal from the bowler, but it was always going down leg
41.3   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, opens the face of the bat to this back of a length delivery outside off and guides it down to third man
41.2   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, FOUR, that's a great shot. Short and wide outside off, Malik hangs back and cuts it to the left of backward point, it crashes into the fence in no time

41.1   Vitori to Shoaib Malik, 2 runs, on a good length and outside off, Malik comes forward and pushes it towards cover, sets off for a quick single. The fielder quickly runs forward and fires a throw at the non-striker's end, there was no one backing up and the batsmen take an extra run on the overthrow
40.6   Mupariwa to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, just short of a good length and on the stumps, Malik punches it down to long-on, he will keep the strike
40.5   Mupariwa to Sohail, 1 run, slower ball on the pads, Sohail works it behind square on the on-side for a single

40.4   Mupariwa to Sohail, no run, on a good length and outside off, Sohail tries to play it very late as he opens the face of the bat to try and run it down towards third man, the ball goes past the outside edge
40.3   Mupariwa to Sohail, no run, angling away outside off, Sohail reaches out and looks to force it through the off-side, gets an inside edge that rolls away to his right

40.2   Mupariwa to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, short and wide outside off once again, Malik cuts it to the right of backward point, sweeper gets across in the deep, the batsmen were in two minds whether to go through for the second run or not and in the end, they decide against it
Shoaib Malik, right handed bat, comes to the crease

40.1   Mupariwa to Azhar Ali, out Caught by Sean Williams!! Azhar Ali has hit a poor ball straight to the fielder. Zimbabwe though won't mind it one bit. This was bowled short and well wide outside off, Ali hangs back and cuts it hard in the air, Williams at backward point takes an easy catch to his right. Ali walks off to a big applause. Azhar Ali c Sean Williams b Mupariwa 102(104) [4s-8]
Mupariwa to Azhar Ali, THATS OUT!! Caught!!
Tawanda Mupariwa [5.0-0-32-0] is back into the attack
The keeper is upto the stumps for Mupariwa

39.6   Vitori to Sohail, FOUR, that's a great shot from Sohail, he lofts this good length delivery straight through the line and poses for the photographers afterwards. Good shot to end the batting powerplay that yielded 35/0

39.5   Vitori to Azhar Ali, 1 run, gives this one more width outside off, Ali slaps it to the left of backward point, who dives and stops the ball, can't prevent the single though. This is Azhar Ali's highest score in ODIs
39.4   Vitori to Sohail, 1 run, short of length delivery angling in on off and middle, Sohail punches it down to long-on and gets to the other end
39.3   Vitori to Sohail, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Sohail gets on top of the bounce and punches it back to the bowler
39.2   Vitori to Azhar Ali, 1 run, on the pads this time, Sohail works it straight to short fine and the batsmen cross over for a quick single
39.1   Vitori to Sohail, 1 run, on a length and just outside off, Sohail drives it wide of mid-off, who runs across to his right, slides and keeps the batsmen down to a single
Brian Vitori [5.0-0-23-0] is back into the attack

38.6   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, 2 runs, Ali gets to his 2nd ODI hundred! He takes his helmet off, waves his bat to his team-mates and the crowd. Everyone in the Pakistani dressing room is also up on their feet, applauding the effort from their captain. Coming back to the ball, it was drifting down leg, Ali tickles it to the right of short fine. The batsmen take two before the fielder chases it down
38.5   Sean Williams to Sohail, 1 run, comes down the track and Williams bowls a full toss on off, Sohail helps it down to long-on
38.4   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Ali goes across and turns it through square leg for a run
38.3   Sean Williams to Sohail, 1 run, eases this one down to long-on and gets to the other end with a single
38.2   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, 1 run, touch quicker on the pads, Ali works it away through mid-wicket for a single
38.1   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, 2 runs, loopy delivery from Williams, Ali steps out, takes it on the full and drives it wide of long-on, good running ensures that they come back for the second

37.6   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, back of a length delivery angled across off, Sohail opens the face of the bat at the last moment, can't beat the man at backward point, who dives to his right and stops the ball
37.5   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, shortish and slightly wide outside off, Sohail cuts it straight to point

37.4   Panyangara to Sohail, FOUR, once again Sohail gives the charge, doesn't try to overhit it and times the inside-out loft beautifully over extra cover and mid-off, runs away to the fence in a jiffy
37.3   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Sohail opens the bat face and looks to run it down to third man, can't beat the man at short third
37.2   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, angling away outside off, Sohail opens the face of the bat and bunts it towards cover-point
37.1   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, length delivery on off, Sohail comes forward and pushes it towards cover
36.6   Sean Williams to Sohail, 1 run, darted on the pads, Sohail comes across and works it away through backward square leg for a single
36.5   Sean Williams to Sohail, FOUR, lovely shot! He comes down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over mid-off, the ball runs away to the fence in no time
36.4   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, 1 run, flatter and on the pads, Ali fails to tickle it fine, the ball rolls away off the pad to short fine. The umpire didn't spot that and gave it as runs
36.3   Sean Williams to Sohail, 1 run, comes down the track and almost yorks himself, ends up squeezing out towards long-on
36.2   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, 1 run, flatter and on middle, Ali stays back and nudges it through mid-wicket, gets to the other end with a single
36.1   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, 2 runs, full and on leg stump line, Ali works it through mid-wicket, calls for the second and makes it with ease
Sean Williams [8.0-0-35-0] is back into the attack

35.6   Panyangara to Sohail, no run, on a good length and angled across off, Sohail tries to work it away into the on-side, gets a leading edge that falls short and to the left of the fielder running forward from extra cover
35.5   Panyangara to Sohail, 2 runs, shortish and slightly wide outside off, Sohail cuts it to deep backward point, comes back for the second with ease

35.4   Panyangara to Azhar Ali, 1 run, that would have been close! This was full and on off, Ali presses forward and drives it to mid-off, he sets off for a single and the fielder quickly runs forward, picks the ball and fires the throw at the non-striker's end, it would have been very tight had he hit the stumps
35.3   Panyangara to Azhar Ali, no run, on a length and outside off, Ali comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
35.2   Panyangara to Sohail, 1 run, on a good length and around off, Sohail opens the face of the bat and guides it down to third man
35.1   Panyangara to Azhar Ali, 1 run, full delivery angling in on off and middle, Ali drives it down to long-on and gets to the other end

Time for the batting powerplay
Drinks are on the field now

34.4   S Raza to Sohail, 1 run, shortish outside off, Sohail rocks back and mistimes the pull, the ball goes on the bounce to the fielder at long-on
34.3   S Raza to Azhar Ali, 1 run, pushed through quicker and just outside off, Ali punches it uppishly past the non-striker, the batsmen take a single as the ball rolls away to long-off
34.2   S Raza to Azhar Ali, no run, flatter and on off, Ali punches it towards cover-point
34.1   S Raza to Azhar Ali, 2 runs, poor ball first up from Raza as it was down leg, Ali works it away behind square on the on-side and comes back for the second
Sikandar Raza, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
33.6   Cremer to Azhar Ali, 1 run, drifts onto the pads, Ali works it in front of square on the leg-side, keeps strike
33.5   Cremer to Azhar Ali, 2 runs, fraction short and outside off, Ali cuts and gets a thick edge, short third gives chase and keeps it down to a couple

33.3   Cremer to Azhar Ali, 2 runs, drops it short, Ali rocks back and pulls, places it between deep mid-wicket and long-on, easy two
33.2   Cremer to Sohail, 1 run, too full and on the stumps, Sohail drives it to long-on
33.1   Cremer to Sohail, no run, tossed up on off, Sohail tries to work it on the leg-side, jams it onto the pad, the ball rolls behind his legs
32.6   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, no run, pushes it back to the bowler off the front foot

32.5   Sean Williams to Azhar Ali, FOUR, second boundary of the over and it is a good shot. Ali skips out of the crease, takes it on the full and whips it past the diving mid-wicket fielder, long-on can't chase it down

31.6   Cremer to Sohail, 1 run, turning into the pads, Sohail stays back and nurdles to backward square, for a single
31.5   Cremer to Sohail, no run, floated up close to off, Sohail presses forward and blocks

31.4   Cremer to Shafiq, out Caught by S Raza!! Cremer has his second of the night. It was beautifully bowled. A big wicket for Zimbabwe as the partnership was growing and setting a platform. Flighted on off, Shafiq comes down the track, closes the bat face as he tried to work it to the on-side, the leading edge lobs towards cover, Raza runs forward, dives and clings on. Shafiq c S Raza b Cremer 39(59) [4s-1]
Cremer to Shafiq, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Welcome back.. Sarfaraz Ahmed is opening with Azhar Ali. Hafeez sprained his leg while attempting to catch a six off Sikandar Raza..

Yasir Shah was the pick of the Pakistani bowlers. He picked up two wickets and conceded only 40 runs in his 10 overs. Riaz was a bit wayward at the start of the innings, but came back well at the end. The Pakistani batsmen have a task on their hands. It is a good batting surface and they should fancy their chances of winning the series today. Join us back in a short while for the run-chase.....

Zimbabwe's innings was a tale of two knocks. First, Chibhabha batted freely and scored a well composed 99. He was very unlucky not to have scored a maiden hundred. Even though Sibanda was not fluent, Chibhabha kept going at the other end. The vistiors lost few quick wickets at the middle stage and that is when Raza came to the crease. He took his time to get going, but once he did, he carted the bowlers all round the park. At the start of the last over, he was on 96 and he managed to reach the landmark unlike Chibhabha. It was his second ODI ton and it has helped Zimbabwe post a decent total.

Teams:

Zimbabwe (Playing XI): Chamu Chibhabha, Vusi Sibanda, Hamilton Masakadza(c), Sean Williams, Richmond Mutumbami(w), Sikandar Raza, Charles Coventry, Graeme Cremer, Tawanda Mupariwa, Brian Vitori, Tinashe Panyangara
Pakistan (Playing XI): Azhar Ali(c), Mohammad Hafeez, Shoaib Malik, Haris Sohail, Asad Shafiq, Sarfraz Ahmed(w), Hammad Azam, Anwar Ali, Wahab Riaz, Mohammad Sami, Yasir Shah
Masakadza: 'We have made four changes. Utseya misses out with sickness, Ervine is out injured, Chigumbura misses out as well. We have another change. We need to put up a big score on the board.'
Azhar Ali: 'We will bowl first. We wanted to bowl in dry conditions. Same team'
Pitch Report: 'Another track that should help the batsmen. Win the toss and bat first, nothing in it for the bowlers,' reckons Rameez Raja
Pakistan have won the toss and have opted to field

There's some injury news from the Zimbabwe camp. Craig Ervine has been ruled out of the remainder of the series with a hamstring injury. The visitors suffered a further blow with skipper Chigumbura dealt a two-match ban for slow overate in the first match. Charles Coventry is expected to feature today as the hosts look to make a comeback into the series.

It was a comprehensive victory for the hosts in the first ODI on Tuesday. Batting first, they piled up a massive 375 on the board. Shoaib Malik made a hundred on his ODI comeback, Azhar Ali continued his rich vein of form while there were fifties for Mohammad Hafeez and Haris Sohail as well. Zimbabwe's reply was spirited with Elton Chigumbura smacking a fine 117, his maiden ODI hundred. Hamilton Masakadza chipped in with a run-a-ball 73 but the visitors still fell short by 41 runs, despite making their highest ever score in an ODI against a Test playing nation. Can the visitors do better today? Hello and a warm welcome to the second ODI between Pakistan and Zimbabwe.

Preview by Siddharth Vishwanathan

Pakistan carried the momentum of their T20I success into the first ODI and their batsmen put on a magnificent show. For the first time, Pakistan's top four went past fifty, with Shoaib Malik leading the way with a brilliant 76-ball 112 as they notched up 375 for 3. However, their smiles would have been tempered with the way Zimbabwe responded with the bat, finishing on 334 for 5 and losing by a margin of 41 runs.

Zimbabwe's fight showed their determination but it also exposed the problems that Pakistan's bowling department faces. The likes of Anwar Ali and Mohammad Sami were dispatched to all parts of the Gaddafi stadium and it needed the experience of Wahab Riaz, who finished with figures of 3 for 47, to help the hosts avoid a major embarrassment.

Heading into the match, Zimbabwe have suffered a big jolt while Pakistan will be aiming for a polished performance to clinch the series.

Venue: Gaddafi stadium, Lahore
Starts: 16:00 local
Weather: Clear skies with a high of 42 degrees

Team news

Pakistan

The bowling was below-par in the first ODI and they may be tempted to bolster their experience in the bowling. Anwar Ali, who had figures of 10-0-81-1, might be replaced by Junaid Khan while Sami, who was making a comeback after three years, might be given another chance after a poor first match.

Probable XI

1 Mohammad Hafeez, 2 Azhar Ali (c), 3 Shoaib Malik, 4 Haris Sohail, 5 Sarfraz Ahmed, 6 Asad Shafiq, 7 Hammad Azam, 8 Wahab Riaz, 9 Yasir Shah, 10 Anwar Ali/Junaid Khan, 11 Mohammad Sami

Zimbabwe

Heading into this match, they have suffered a major blow. Elton Chigumbura, who blasted 117 off 95 balls, has been suspended for the remaining two ODIs due to a slow over-rate offence. His absence will throw the team composition in disarray and it will be interesting to see how who will captain the side in his absence. Chigumbura's absence could see Roy Kaia, the 23-year-old Mountaineers allrounder, making his debut on Thursday.

Probable XI

1 Vusi Sibanda, 2 Sikandar Raza, 3 Hamilton Masakadza, 4 Roy Kaia, 5 Sean Williams, 6 Craig Ervine, 7 Richmond Mutumbami, 8 Prosper Utseya, 9 Tinashe Panyangara, 10 Chris Mpofu, 11 Brian Vitori
